what_if.Question: what would happen to the predictions for instances with diabetes pedigree function less than 0.368 if you were to change bmi to 22.3?
what_if.Answer: For this subset of pedigree function less than 0.368 if bmi is 22.3, then 88% are unlikely to have diabetes and the rest are likely to have it.

what_if.Question: what would happen to the class probabilities if we increased blood pressure by 94?
what_if.Answer: Increasing blood pressure by 94 will put 20% of the data into likely to have diabetes.

what_if.Question: what if we took 40 points away from skin thickness for id 157 what would happen to the probability of the predictions?
what_if.Answer: patient 157 is 80% unlikely to have diabetes if skin thickness is decreased by 40.

what_if.Question: what would the predictions be if you set the diabetes pedigree function to 0.409 on the entire dataset?
what_if.Answer: setting the diabetes pedigree function to 0.409 makes 35% of instances in the entire dataset likely to have diabetes.

what_if.Question: what are the modelâ€™s predictions on diabetes pedigree function less than 12 and what would it be if you decreased insulin by 0.409?
what_if.Information: 63% diabetes is likely, with and without decreasing insulin
what_if.Answer: for this subset of diabetes pedigree function less than 12, 63% are unlikely to have diabetes, and decreasing insulin by 0.409 does not change it

what_if.Question: tell me what the model would predict if you decreased skin thickness by 5 on all the data
what_if.Answer: If we decrease skin thickness by 5 then 64% of all data points are unlikely to have diabetes.

what_if.Question: what would the prediction for id 667 be if you change the insulin level to 49?
what_if.Answer: Setting insulin to 49 for patient 667 causes the model to predict they are unlikely to have diabetes.

what_if.Question: what would happen to the distribution of model predictions if people with glucose less than 130 had blood pressure decreased by 108 and insulin set to 30?
what_if.Answer: For the subset of data with glucose less than 130, if we drop blood pressure by 108 then 87% of them are unlikely to have diabetes

pred_likelihood.Question: how likely is id 127 to have diabetes?
pred_likelihood.Answer: patient with id 127 is 86% likely to have diabetes

pred_likelihood.Question: what is the probability that id 317 is predicted as likely to have diabetes by the model?
pred_likelihood.Answer: Patient 317 is 90% likely to have diabetes.

pred_likelihood.Answer: Patient 451 is 13% likely to have diabetes.

pred_likelihood.Question: what is the likelihood that id 336 is predicted as likely to have diabetes by the model?
pred_likelihood.Answer: Patient 336 is 45% likely to have diabetes.

pred_likelihood.Question: what is the chance that the data point with id 595 is likely to have diabetes
pred_likelihood.Answer: Patient 595 is 79% likely to have diabetes
